alert.note: Alert for Orange (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 16 at 7:45AM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Patchy Dense Fog Across Northwest Portions of Orange County Early This Morning... At 730 AM, traffic cameras and satellite imagery showed locally dense fog had formed across northwest Orange County. The fog appeared to be a little more dense and widespread north of Florida`s Turnpike through the Apopka and Zellwood areas. Visibilities across this area may be reduced to around a quarter of a mile or less. Motorist on areas roadways north of Florida`s Turnpike and west of I-4 in Orange County, such as State Road 429, and U.S. Route 441 should prepare to encounter rapid changes in visibility from locally dense fog. When driving in fog, reduce your speed, use only your low beam headlights, and leave extra distance between your vehicle and the one in front of you. The fog is expected to burn off between 8 and 9 AM.
